DataElement.preferredName: Material Process Step Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Status Date and Time ISO21090.TS.DATETIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed act of processing a material. EXAMPLE(S): freezing, thawing, spinning, embedding, dividing, aliquot, adding additives or growth factors OTHER NAME(S): product manipulation NOTE(S): Material process may be performed on any kind of material, such as specimen, nanomaterial, or biologic. The result of the process may be similar or different kind of material, e.g. specimen may be result of specimen processing step (aliquot or division of a specimen), or alternatively blood product has anticoagulants added to it to preserve product. Other processing steps, e.g. adding growth factor to induce cell growth, may be performed on blood product. The date (and time) on which the status is assigned to the activity.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Material Process Step Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Status Date and Time
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.:A sequence of events which produces some outcome.:A specific stage of progression through a sequential process.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._A condition or state at a particular time.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

Concepts.definition: The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.
A sequence of events which produces some outcome.
A specific stage of progression through a sequential process.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Constrains TS so that it's precision can not be more precise than seconds.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)
